Neuroscience.structures.Activity_Detector¶

class Neuroscience.structures.Activity_Detector.Activity_Detector(watch_neurons)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that monitors and detects the activity of neurons in a neural network.

The Activity_Detector class keeps track of the membrane potential of a set of neurons and records whether each neuron is active or inactive. It uses timeouts to determine the activity state based on the neuron’s potential compared to the action potential threshold.

The important property of the Activity Detector compared to the Frequency Detector is that it notices activity with a constant offset of [DELAY] thus the period of activity and inactivity remains the same as originally. On the other hand, the Frequency detector notices the frequence as soon as it noticed two spikes and the frequence comes back to 0 once [DELAY] has passed.

name¶

The name of the activity detector, initialized as “Activity Detector”.

Type

str

watch_neurons¶

The list of neurons being monitored by the activity detector.

Type

list of Abstract_Neuron

len¶

The number of neurons being monitored.

Type

int

inactive_timeout¶

A list that tracks the inactive timeout for each neuron. Initialized to -1.

Type

list of int

active_timeout¶

A list that tracks the active timeout for each neuron. Initialized to -1.

Type

list of int

active_neurons¶

A list that records the activity state (“0” for inactive, “1” for active) of each neuron.

Type

list of str

DELAY = 800¶

The delay period (in simulation steps) used to determine the transition between active and inactive states.

.

get_activity()[source]¶

Gets the current activity status of the monitored neurons.

Returns

A string representing the activity status of each neuron (“0” for inactive, “1” for active).

Return type

str

.

print_activity()[source]¶

Returns the current activity status of the monitored neurons as a string.

Returns

A string representing the activity status of each neuron (“0” for inactive, “1” for active).

Return type

str

.

update_activity()[source]¶

Updates the activity status of the monitored neurons.

This method checks each neuron s membrane potential and updates its activity state based on the action potential threshold. The state is updated using timeouts to manage transitions between active and inactive states.

.
